text:
I remember my childhood like it was yesterday. I was born and raised in a small town in the Midwest, and my family was very close. Growing up, there were four of us kids, and we were all about the same age. We were always getting into mischief and having a lot of fun.

My parents were hard-working people, and they always made sure that we had the basics we needed. Even though we didn't have much money, my parents gave us love and attention, which was really all we needed.

I spent a lot of my childhood playing outdoors. My siblings and I would go explore the woods, build forts, play tag and all sorts of other games. We were always getting into trouble and our parents were always calling us back home.

I also remember how excited I was when school started. I was always eager to learn new things and meet new friends. I was an average student, but I had a lot of friends and was involved in a lot of activities. I was a cheerleader and was very involved in my school's theater productions.

Our family didn't have a lot of money, but my parents always made sure that we had what we needed. We would often go to the library to get books, take family hikes, and make trips to the local amusement park. We didn't have a lot of money, but my parents always found ways to make sure we had fun.

My parents always encouraged us to make the most of the opportunities we had. They taught us to be hard-working, kind and generous. They also taught us to value education and to try our best.

My childhood was filled with love and laughter, and I cherish those memories. Even though I'm now an adult, I still remember the little things that made me so happy when I was a child. I still love going for hikes and exploring nature, and I still love going to the theater. I'm thankful for the wonderful childhood I had and the wonderful parents who raised me.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, antagonistic, conscientious, emotionally stable, and open to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points

(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
